content:
Ah, now I see the core issue - we don't have a burner inserter in our inventory! Let's check our inventory first and craft one if needed:

```python
# First check our inventory
print(f"Current inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")

# Craft a burner inserter if we don't have one
craft_item(Prototype.BurnerInserter, 1)
print("Crafted a burner inserter")

# Get reference points
drill = get_entities({Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill})[0]
furnace = get_entities({Prototype.StoneFurnace})[0]

# Move to the drill's drop position
move_to(drill.drop_position)
print(f"Moved to drill's drop position at {drill.drop_position}")

# Now place the inserter
inserter = place_entity(
    Prototype.BurnerInserter,
    position=drill.drop_position,
    direction=Direction.RIGHT
)
print(f"Placed inserter at {inserter.position}")

# Add fuel to inserter
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, inserter, quantity=1)
print("Added fuel to inserter")

# Show final setup
print(f"Final setup:")
print(f"Drill drop position: {drill.drop_position}")
print(f"Inserter position: {inserter.position}")
print(f"Furnace position: {furnace.position}")
```

This should first ensure we have an inserter to place, then proceed with the placement at the correct position.
